title: Newtons first law - velocity of glider

content.question: A glider on a horizontal air track with negligible friction has a constant rightward force exerted on it between time <math alttext="t equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math> and <math alttext="t equals t sub f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>t</mi><mi>f</mi></msub></math>. At <math alttext="t equals t sub f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>t</mi><mi>f</mi></msub></math> the rightward force suddenly becomes zero and remains zero. Which of the following graphs of velocity as a function of time best describes the motion of the glider?

choices.label: The figure shows a line graph in the first quadrant of a coordinate plane, with the origin labeled O. The horizontal axis is labeled t, and the value t sub f is indicated along it. The vertical axis is labeled v, and no values are indicated along it. The line graph begins at the origin and slants upward and to the right. At t sub f it is two thirds of the way up the v axis. The line graph then slants downward and to the right, and ends at the end of the t axis and one half of the way up the v axis.

The vertical axis is labeled v, and no values are indicated along it. The line graph begins at the origin and slants upward and to the right. At t sub f it is two thirds of the way up the v axis. The line graph then goes horizontally to the right, and ends at the end of the t axis and two thirds of the way up the v axis.

The figure shows the graph of a curve in the first quadrant of a coordinate plane, with the origin labeled O. The horizontal axis is labeled t, and the value t sub f is indicated along it. At time t sub f, the curve is one fourth of the way up the v axis. To the right of t sub f, the curve slants upward to the right and ends at the end of the t axis and near the top of the v axis.

The figure shows the graph of a curve in the first quadrant of a coordinate plane, with the origin labeled O. The horizontal axis is labeled t, and the value t sub f is indicated along it. The vertical axis is labeled v, and no values are indicated along it. The curve begins at the origin, and curves upward and to the right at an increasing rate. At time t sub f, the curve is one fourth of the way up the vertical v axis. From there, the curve continues moving upward and to the right but levels off as it does, and becomes nearly horizontal as it ends at the end of the t axis and two thirds of the way up the v axis.
